com.bandyer.core_av.publisher

Class Publisher

  • com.bandyer.core_av.publisher.Publisher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CapturerObserver, Recordable

    public class Publisher
implements CapturerObserver, Recordable

    This class represents a publisher of a stream. A publisher is someone who is in read-write mode on a stream. There can be only one local publisher at a time in the room. The publisher needs a capturer ( audio/video ) to be able to fetch the data to stream.

    The first step to use the publisher is create it, by instantiating with a user it refers to.

      Creates a publisher

      Publisher addPublisherObserver(PublisherObserver observer)
      Method to add an observer to the publisher. The observer will be notified when a change has occurred
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
      Equality method based on the publisher identifier
      boolean getCanRecord()
      Indicates whether the receiver can be recorded, or not. Note: Recording is supported in ROUTED rooms only. true if the receiver can be recorded, false otherwise.
      boolean getCanStartRecorder()
      Indicates whether the receiver can start the recorder, or not. The recorder can be started only when in routed rooms and in connected state. true if the receiver can start the recorder, false otherwise.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Unique identifier for the publisher
      com.bandyer.core_av.networking.models.PubSubOptions getOptions()
      Publishing options, by default the publishing is done with audio and video

      Publisher state, by default is set to UN_PUBLISHED

      • setCapturer

        public Publisher setCapturer(AbstractBaseCapturer<?> capturer,
                             boolean autoDispose,
                             com.bandyer.core_av.networking.models.MuteStreamOption muteOption)

        Method to set the capturer to be used, and the additional options such as mute a channel

        Parameters:
        capturer - can be CapturerAV/CapturerAudio/CapturerVideo
        autoDispose - by default the capturer will be disposed along side with the publisher, if set to false the developer will need to handle the disposal
        muteOption - option to mute a channel that is being captured
        Returns:
        Publisher

      • startRecording

        public void startRecording(RecordingListener listener)

        Sends a request to the room host asking to start the recording of the published stream. Upon success or failure the observers will be notified on the respective callbacks.

        Parameters:
        listener - callback returning the status of the request
